data.title: Fixed gdi3lose.vqa crash
data.body:
Fixes #8132.

This just fixes the crash for now, but the video has still weird audio (and always had). I will look into fixing the audio and other vqa problems soon, but I probably won't have time for it in the next few weeks.

data.title: InvalidOperationException in OpenRA.Editor.Surface.GetPaletteForPlayerInner
data.body:
Noticed the following crash in OpenRA.Editor.exe when testing the new in-game one. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8065#issuecomment-100812321

```
System.InvalidOperationException: TypeDictionary does not contain instance of type `OpenRA.Traits.PlayerColorPaletteInfo`
  at OpenRA.Primitives.TypeDictionary.Get[PlayerColorPaletteInfo] () [0x00089] in /home/matthias/Entwicklung/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Primitives/TypeDictionary.cs:63 
  at OpenRA.Editor.Surface.GetPaletteForPlayerInner (System.String name) [0x00036] in /home/matthias/Entwicklung/OpenRA/OpenRA.Editor/Surface.cs:394 
  at OpenRA.Exts.GetOrAdd[String,ColorPalette] (System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 d, System.String k, System.Func`2 createFn) [0x00013] in /home/matthias/Entwicklung/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Exts.cs:129 
  at OpenRA.Primitives.Cache`2[System.String,System.Drawing.Imaging.ColorPalette].get_Item (System.String key) [0x0000e] in /home/matthias/Entwicklung/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/Primitives/Cache.cs:35 
  at OpenRA.Editor.Surface.GetPaletteForPlayer (System.String player) [0x0002a] in /home/matthias/Entwicklung/OpenRA/OpenRA.Editor/Surface.cs:406 
  at OpenRA.Editor.Surface.GetPaletteForActor (OpenRA.ActorReference ar) [0x00021] in /home/matthias/Entwicklung/OpenRA/OpenRA.Editor/Surface.cs:415 
  at OpenRA.Editor.Surface.OnPaint (System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs e) [0x0042f] in /home/matthias/Entwicklung/OpenRA/OpenRA.Editor/Surface.cs:467 
  at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WmPaint (System.Windows.Forms.Message& m) [0x0008a] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-3.12.1/mcs/class/Managed.Windows.Forms/System.Windows.Forms/Control.cs:5245 
  at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc (System.Windows.Forms.Message& m) [0x0015f] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-3.12.1/mcs/class/Managed.Windows.Forms/System.Windows.Forms/Control.cs:5007 
  at System.Windows.Forms.Control+ControlWindowTarget.OnMessage (System.Windows.Forms.Message& m) [0x00000] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-3.12.1/mcs/class/Managed.Windows.Forms/System.Windows.Forms/Control.cs:228 
  at System.Windows.Forms.Control+ControlNativeWindow.WndProc (System.Windows.Forms.Message& m) [0x00000] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-3.12.1/mcs/class/Managed.Windows.Forms/System.Windows.Forms/Control.cs:209 
  at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.WndProc (IntPtr hWnd, Msg msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam) [0x0008e] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-3.12.1/mcs/class/Managed.Windows.Forms/System.Windows.Forms/NativeWindow.cs:240
```

data.title: sound.log errors while interacting with different buttons (Mod chooser/Asset downloader)
data.body:
Version is release (20150424) - not checked on bleed

sound.log gets the current lines:

LoadSound, file does not exist: button.aud
Attempt to Play2D a null `ISoundSource`

When you try to click on any of the mods in the mod chooser, sound.log gets populated with the errors, and for every time you try to switch mod (Don't load it, just make it active), it will add another line of 
"Attempt to Play2D a null `ISoundSource`"

data.title: Ingame Map Editor: tile glitch
data.body:
I noticed a "tile glitch" in the editor : ater applying a tile (temperat tileset, debris, tile 107) on the ground and then, selecting another one in the sidebar, I noticed that, for half a second, a tile is displayed over the map, then quickly vanishes.

Steps to reproduce it:  select a big tile, use it, then right click (to unselect the tile), then reselect the tile in the sidebar. You'll notice that the tile quickly appears like a ghost for 1/4 second.

data.title: Ingame Map Editor: auto-save the map in the background
data.body:
Maybe there could be some kind of auto-save feature in OpenRA to save the current map in the background (or when the auto-restart dialog is displayed #8133)? This way, after the auto-restart, the user could find his/her previous map like it was before. 

Something similar to what text editors do.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/14099303-ingame-map-editor-auto-save-the-map-in-the-background?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Auto-restart doesn't know that a map is being created
data.body:
Let's say you have really well started your map and for a reason, you want to change the display mode or resolution. you can do that in Settings but there's no warning about the map you are editing.. 

it could be a problem (it wouldn't be that smart to want to change the resolution while creating a map but who knows...)

So, maybe there should be a warning or a small dialog window asking the user to save the map before restarting OpenRA.

data.body: Fixes #8129.

data.title: Fixed glitchy remap errors of non-fitting actors on certain tilesets
data.body: The new map editor / sprite loader will fall back and loads actor regarding of missing/incompatible file ending which introduces palette problems that were hidden by the behavior of OpenRA.Editor.exe and my #4496. This fixes all glitches I could spot such as a cactus/sand/pyramids in TEMPERAT terrain etc. To be tested with https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8065.

data.body: In input tab of settings menu, assigning new hotkeys doesn't work. The key keeps flashing all the time. This is for the latest release and also current bleed.

data.title: Music File not playing as intended
data.body:
So I imported some music from Itunes and used an online m4a to wav converter.
Website: http://www.zamzar.com/uploadComplete.php?convertFile=m4a&to=wav
It works fine in Windows Media Player and Audacity, and tests fine in CNC Mixer. The Aud file I make out of it plays okay too.

Yet when I play the music in game, the music player seems to barf (make all the jokes about my taste in music you want ;) )

For example: I put in a song called Prescription Beats (Chemical Brothers)- there's a strong percussion in the beginning and its relatively fast in tempo.

When CnC plays it, it is slow, constantly sounding as though it is about to crash (thankfully it doesn't, but the point remains.)

Does anyone know what causes this?

data.title: Reorganize palette loading.
data.body: Reorganizes the way that player palettes are loaded, and fixes a bug that would cause the shroud and terrain palettes to break if too many players were added in the editor.  Preqrequisite of #8065.

data.title: Remove Owner from ActorPreviews.
data.body: This takes them one step closer to being useable by utilities that don't set up a real world.  Prerequisite of #8065.

So here is mission number 6.

There is a problem that causes a crash. I try to add flare to the cnc mod because it is needed in this mission. But i failed  and always get this error:

`Unit `smokland` does not have a sequence named `open``

So I need a little hellp here...

data.title: Disabled production when a factory gets captured

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Introduced in #6766. The problematic parts are [lines 56-58 in `ClassicProductionQueue.cs`](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/50d726ea317f643fd35fd706d5dc9584d3073d8a/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Player/ClassicProductionQueue.cs#L56-L58).

The _real_ problem is that both `Transform` and `ExternalCapture` lock the building and so are indistinguishable to other code and aren't treated differently.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/13930430-disabled-production-when-a-factory-gets-captured?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Voice is played twice when selecting actor(s) via group key
data.body: Something must be wrong in `Selection`-related code. When selecting a group via group key, the "Select" voice is played twice.

data.title: Decouple Selection Bounds from visual selection box
data.body:
In my opinion this should be solved more like in the originals, where the visible selection box was purely cosmetic and not directly related to actual selectable area.

In other words, `Bounds` should control the selectable area just like now, while something like `SelectionBoxSize` (possibly moved to `SelectionDecorations`) should control the size and position of the visible selection box.

data.title: Rework mod content installation directories and add D2k videos
data.body:
Until now there hasn't been need for the videos.
#8117 introduces the first use-case.

~~I didn't add all videos, because chances are it would be a while before they are needed, and currently `\OpenRA\Content\d2k\` is a mess which I hope I (or even better - someone else ;) ) will fix soon (caused by the way `ContentInstaller`, `InstallFromCDLogic` and `InstallUtils` don't care about target directory, they just dump everything in `\OpenRA\Content\<mod>\`).~~

**EDIT:**

OK this got expanded quite a bit. Here is what you can find:
- The content installer now actually cares about what file should go in what directory. (Right now D2k's Content directory contains 3 empty directories and 260 files (without the videos) dumped in the root dir. This makes it much better.) This would also be useful for RA2, seing it has a ton of files as well.
- D2k now gets videos (that was in the first push)
- The VQA player now doesn't crash on D2k videos (that was also in the first push)
- Fixes errors when installing game assets via the Install Music button. (or at least fixes some of the cases when that happens, there is still one case left, as I mentioned [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6242#issuecomment-100659964))

Fixes #6117.

The added check in `Format80` is to prevent `IndexOutOfRange` exceptions in `Format80.ReplicatePrevious()`. I've been told TD and RA videos still play.

I tested RA and D2k extensively both with Copy from CD and Download assets.

Notes:
- D2k downloads 1 file more than is copied from the CD - PALETTE.BIN  (I have nothing to do with this, but we should figure out whether we need that file).
- Downloading the assets will not place the tilesets in the correct (new) directory for some reason.
